verses.kjv: And after these things I saw another angel come down from heaven, having great power; and the earth was lightened with his glory.
verses.ct: After this, I saw a different angel descending from heaven with immense authority, and the earth was illuminated by his glory.

verses.kjv: And he cried mightily with a strong voice, saying, Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and is become the habitation of devils, and the hold of every foul spirit, and a cage of every unclean and hateful bird.
verses.ct: He shouted with a powerful voice, saying, "Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great! She has become a dwelling place for demons, a prison for every evil spirit, and a cage for every disgusting and detestable bird."

verses.kjv: For all nations have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her fornication, and the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her, and the merchants of the earth are waxed rich through the abundance of her delicacies.
verses.ct: Every nation has drunk the wine of her passionate immorality. The kings of the earth have been sexually immoral with her, and the merchants of the earth have grown wealthy from her excessive luxury.

verses.kjv: And I heard another voice from heaven, saying, Come out of her, my people, that ye be not partakers of her sins, and that ye receive not of her plagues.
verses.ct: Then I heard another voice from heaven say, "Leave her, my people, so that you don't share in her sins and so that you don't suffer from her plagues."

verses.kjv: For her sins have reached unto heaven, and God hath remembered her iniquities.
verses.ct: "Her sins have piled up as high as heaven, and God has not forgotten her crimes."

verses.kjv: Reward her even as she rewarded you, and double unto her double according to her works: in the cup which she hath filled fill to her double.
verses.ct: "Pay her back the same way she paid you, and give her double for what she has done. In the cup she mixed, mix a double portion for her."

verses.kjv: How much she hath glorified herself, and lived deliciously, so much torment and sorrow give her: for she saith in her heart, I sit a queen, and am no widow, and shall see no sorrow.
verses.ct: "To the same degree that she glorified herself and indulged in luxury, give her that much torment and grief. Because she tells herself, 'I sit as a queen. I am not a widow, and I will never experience sorrow.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore shall her plagues come in one day, death, and mourning, and famine; and she shall be utterly burned with fire: for strong is the Lord God who judgeth her.
verses.ct: "For this reason, her plagues will arrive in a single day — death, mourning, and famine — and she will be completely consumed by fire, because the Lord God who judges her is mighty."

verses.kjv: And the kings of the earth, who have committed fornication and lived deliciously with her, shall bewail her, and lament for her, when they shall see the smoke of her burning,
verses.ct: The kings of the earth who were sexually immoral with her and shared in her luxury will weep and grieve over her when they see the smoke rising from her destruction.

verses.kjv: Standing afar off for the fear of her torment, saying, Alas, alas that great city Babylon, that mighty city! for in one hour is thy judgment come.
verses.ct: They will stand far away, terrified by her suffering, and say, "How terrible, how terrible for you, great city Babylon, you powerful city! In just 1 hour your judgment has arrived."

verses.kjv: And the merchants of the earth shall weep and mourn over her; for no man buyeth their merchandise any more:
verses.ct: The merchants of the earth will cry and grieve over her because no one buys their goods anymore:

verses.kjv: The merchandise of gold, and silver, and precious stones, and of pearls, and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and scarlet, and all thyine wood, and all manner vessels of ivory, and all manner vessels of most precious wood, and of brass, and iron, and marble,
verses.ct: their cargo of gold, silver, precious gems, pearls, fine linen, purple cloth, silk, scarlet fabric, every kind of citron wood, every sort of ivory item, every kind of product made from expensive wood, bronze, iron, and marble,

verses.kjv: And cinnamon, and odours, and ointments, and frankincense, and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and wheat, and beasts, and sheep, and horses, and chariots, and slaves, and souls of men.
verses.ct: along with cinnamon, spices, incense, frankincense, wine, olive oil, fine flour, wheat, cattle, sheep, horses, chariots, and even human bodies and souls.

verses.kjv: And the fruits that thy soul lusted after are departed from thee, and all things which were dainty and goodly are departed from thee, and thou shalt find them no more at all.
verses.ct: "The ripe fruit your soul craved has vanished from you. All your luxury and splendor are gone, and you will never find them again."

verses.kjv: The merchants of these things, which were made rich by her, shall stand afar off for the fear of her torment, weeping and wailing,
verses.ct: The merchants who got rich from trading with her will stand far away, terrified by her suffering, crying and mourning.

verses.kjv: And saying, Alas, alas, that great city, that was clothed in fine linen, and purple, and scarlet, and decked with gold, and precious stones, and pearls!
verses.ct: They will say, "How terrible, how terrible for the great city that was dressed in fine linen, purple, and scarlet, and adorned with gold, precious gems, and pearls!"

verses.kjv: For in one hour so great riches is come to nought. And every shipmaster, and all the company in ships, and sailors, and as many as trade by sea, stood afar off,
verses.ct: "In just 1 hour, all that enormous wealth has been wiped out!" Every ship captain, every passenger, all the sailors, and everyone who makes a living from the sea stood at a distance.

verses.kjv: And cried when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, What city is like unto this great city!
verses.ct: They shouted when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, "What city was ever like this great city?"

verses.kjv: And they cast dust on their heads, and cried, weeping and wailing, saying, Alas, alas, that great city, wherein were made rich all that had ships in the sea by reason of her costliness! for in one hour is she made desolate.
verses.ct: They threw dust on their heads and cried out, weeping and mourning, "How terrible, how terrible for the great city where everyone who owned ships on the sea became rich from her wealth! In just 1 hour she has been reduced to nothing."

verses.kjv: Rejoice over her, thou heaven, and ye holy apostles and prophets; for God hath avenged you on her.
verses.ct: "Celebrate over her, heaven! Celebrate, holy apostles and prophets! God has pronounced judgment on her for what she did to you."

verses.kjv: And a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone, and cast it into the sea, saying, Thus with violence shall that great city Babylon be thrown down, and shall be found no more at all.
verses.ct: Then a powerful angel picked up a boulder the size of a massive millstone and hurled it into the sea, saying, "With this kind of violent force, the great city Babylon will be thrown down and will never be found again."

verses.kjv: And the voice of harpers, and musicians, and of pipers, and trumpeters, shall be heard no more at all in thee; and no craftsman, of whatsoever craft he be, shall be found any more in thee; and the sound of a millstone shall be heard no more at all in thee;
verses.ct: "The sound of harp players, musicians, flute players, and trumpet players will never be heard in you again. No craftsman of any trade will ever be found in you again. The grinding of a millstone will never be heard in you again."

verses.kjv: And the light of a candle shall shine no more at all in thee; and the voice of the bridegroom and of the bride shall be heard no more at all in thee: for thy merchants were the great men of the earth; for by thy sorceries were all nations deceived.
verses.ct: "The glow of a lamp will never shine in you again. The voices of a groom and bride will never be heard in you again. Your merchants were the most powerful people on earth, and through your sorcery every nation was led astray."

verses.kjv: And in her was found the blood of prophets, and of saints, and of all that were slain upon the earth.
verses.ct: In her was discovered the blood of prophets, of God's holy people, and of everyone who has been killed on the earth.
